briefdescription.para: tag for update request
whether to filter out legend elements outside of the atlas feature
Will be true if the legend size should be totally reset at next paint.
Will be false until the associated map scale and DPI have been calculated.
Will be true if the legend should be resized automatically to fit contents.

detaileddescription.para:
This is the item's id if set, and if not, a user-friendly string identifying item type.
id()

briefdescription.para: Returns whether a stroke will be drawn around raster symbol items.
Returns whether column widths should be equalized.
Called after all pending items have been restored from XML.

detaileddescription.para:
Items can use this method to run steps which must take place after all items have been restored to the layout, such as connecting to signals emitted by other items, which may not have existed in the layout at the time readXml() was called. E.g. a scalebar can use this to connect to its linked map item after restoration from XML.
readXml()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the legend should automatically resize to fit its contents.

parameterdescription.para: set to false to disable automatic resizing. The legend frame will not be expanded to fit legend items, and items may be cropped from display.

detaileddescription.para: The caller takes responsibility for deleting the returned object.

briefdescription.para: Draws the item's contents using the specified item render context.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the context's painter has been scaled so that painter units are pixels. Use the QgsRenderContext methods to convert from millimeters or other units to the painter's units.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomElement &element, const QDomDocument &document, const QgsReadWriteContext &context) override
memberdef.name: readPropertiesFromElement

briefdescription.para: Sets item state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
element
is the DOM element for the item
document
DOM document
context
read write context
Note that item subclasses should not rely on all other items being present in the layout at the time this method is called. Instead, any connections and links to other items must be made in the finalizeRestoreFromXml() method. E.g. when restoring a scalebar, the connection to the linked map's signals should be implemented in finalizeRestoreFromXml(), not readPropertiesFromElement().

briefdescription.para: Stores item state within an XML DOM element.

parameterdescription.para: is the DOM element to store the item's properties in

briefdescription.para: Removes the associated map if the map is deleted.
update legend in case style of associated map has changed
react to atlas
actual filter update
use new custom layer tree and update model. if new root is null pointer, will use project's tree
A layout item subclass for map legends.
